description.plain:
Aaron Dontez Yates (born November 8, 1971), better known by his stage name Tech N9ne, is a chopper-style rapper from Kansas City, Missouri. He has been rapping since 1985 and during the ’90s, he was in the hip-hop group Nnutthowze.

In 2000, Tech N9ne, along with Travis O'Guin, founded Strange Music, Inc, the independent record label currently owned by Tech and co-owned by O'Guin. Strange Music currently has 12 artists on its roster.

In 2006, he independently released his album Everready (The Religion), and though his album just prior–Absolute Power– is his highest selling album to date ( 358,000 copies sold), Everready is considered by many to still be his best work.

Tech N9ne is the most successful independent rapper of all time. He has sold over 2 million copies independently. In 2010, it was confirmed that his record label, Strange Music, is worth about $68 million (album sales, tours, merchandise, etc.)

He has sold over 2.2 million albums and has had his music featured in film, television, and video games. In 2009, he won the Left Field Woodie award at the mtvU Woodie Awards. He also held a four-consecutive-year streak atop the Forbes Cash Kings list, one of only five artists ever to maintain a standing for such a length of time. Between 2013 and 2017, he received three gold plaques and one platinum plaque for three different songs, “Caribou Lou”, “Fragile”, and “Hood Go Crazy”.

songs.full_title: Speedom (Worldwide Choppers 2) by Tech N9ne (Ft. Eminem & Krizz Kaliko)
songs.title: Speedom (Worldwide Choppers 2)

description.plain:
The long awaited Tech N9ne x Eminem collab is finally here. Fans of both camps have wanted to see this happen ever since the two both appeared on the 1999 song “The Anthem.” Em was meant to appear on “She Devil”, “My World”, & “So Lonely” but it never came through.

Tech & Eminem spoke to Sway, describing the song as a “puzzle” and a tribute to singer Richie Havens’s “Freedom.”

Instead of money, Eminem wanted a favor from Tech N9ne as an exchange for this verse. His wish was for Tech N9ne to deliver Em a verse on a project from Shady Records, and he did. Check out “Beast” featuring Busta Rhymes, KXNG CROOKED and Tech N9ne.

songs.full_title: Fragile by Tech N9ne (Ft. Kendall Morgan, Kendrick Lamar & ¡MAYDAY!)
songs.title: Fragile

description.plain:
This song is about how critics easily criticize artists' music and how bad it feels for the artists to take all that criticism.

Here’s an interview where he, amongst other things, discusses this very song “Fragile”
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h-BeXNv1xv4

Yelawolf was also to be featured on this song but his verse wasn’t sent in time (source: Something Else DVD).

songs.full_title: Sriracha by Tech N9ne (Ft. Joyner Lucas & Logic)
songs.title: Sriracha

description.plain:
“Sriracha” gets its name from a Thai hot sauce, which Tech apparently puts on everything. Metaphorically speaking, Tech puts fire on all of his tracks, which he showcases with his signature fast flows and aggressive lyricism.

This song also potentially started beef between Joyner and Logic as seen in this interview:
https://youtu.be/E3u2AES9i0k

songs.title: Straight Out the Gate
songs.title_with_featured: Straight Out the Gate (Ft. Krizz Kaliko & Serj Tankian)

description.plain:
Kicking off the feature-packed Something Else with System of a Down’s Serj Tankian, Straight Out the Gate is Tech N9ne’s opening delivery of dopeness. Tech reports having been a fan of SOAD since he heard their single Sugar in 1999. This collaboration is only another confirmation of Tech N9ne’s status as rock n' roll rap genius.



Source: http://hardknock.tv/tech-n9ne-talks-straight-out-the-gate-working-w-serj-tankian-sugar-soad-more/

songs.full_title: Dysfunctional by Tech N9ne (Ft. Big Scoob & Krizz Kaliko)
songs.title: Dysfunctional

description.plain:
In one of the biggest underground hits of the year, the 3 Strange artists express their emotional instability and lyrical insanity with an upbeat production and its classic hook.

-Tech talks about encountering all these insignificant fans and hustlers

-Scoob talks about how his environment and history have effectively  blocked all possible lanes in his career

-Kaliko shows that he could go harder than Tech in terms of psychological disorder

songs.full_title: B.I.T.C.H. by Tech N9ne (Ft. T-Pain)
songs.title: B.I.T.C.H.

description.plain:
“B.I.T.C.H.” is Tech N9ne’s lyrical expression of the lack of acceptance he’s felt in the Hip Hop, and more so, the African American community throughout most of his career.

As Tech discussed in his 2004 documentary T9X: The Tech N9ne Experience, his fallout with the black community started with the release of his album Anghellic in 2001

With Anghellic I think a lot of my people were scared of me; thought I was a devil worshiper because they didn’t look deep into it.

And more specifically with the track “This Ring”, which Tech stated on his 2010 song “Losing My Mind”

…started a lot of the Tech N9ne hoopla.

Journalists Justin Hunte goes into greater detail in his HipHopDX Breakdown on Why isn’t Tech N9ne the G.O.A.T. ?

https://m.youtube.com/watch?feature=youtu.be&v=oRvdAwdkyWM

songs.full_title: Like I Ain't by Tech N9ne
songs.title: Like I Ain’t

description.plain:
In “Like I Ain’t,” Tech N9ne speaks on his disillusionment with the music industry as a consequence of not being appreciated or recognized to the degree that he feels he deserves. He celebrates his career in spite of this, and runs through a selection of some of his finest moments and achievements.

One recurring theme in the track is naming some of the many esteemed artists whom he has worked with, namely: 2Pac, Eminem, Corey Taylor, Twista, Lil Wayne, Kendrick Lamar, T.I., 2 Chainz, B.o.B, Hopsin and Joyner Lucas.

songs.full_title: Caribou Lou by Tech N9ne
songs.title: Caribou Lou

description.plain:
Tech N9ne and his friends were one day at a party in 1995 mixing up some drinks and came up with Caribou Lou (A mixture of 151 Rum, Pineapple juice and Malibu liquor). This is the song he made in 2006 on the album Everready promoting the drink which became the life of the party in Kansas City and all around the world.

In 2013, Caribou Lou became a certified gold record, Tech’s first.

songs.full_title: He's a Mental Giant by Tech N9ne
songs.title: He’s a Mental Giant

description.plain:
This is the first official single off of Tech N9ne’s 12th full studio effort, All 6’s And 7’s.

In this song, Tech N9ne decides to be narcissistic and big-headed. He has been humble for too long and now he feels he needs to shut some rappers up and address some issues, along with some crazy punchlines.

Produced by Seven, the sample is taken from a classic 1939 cartoon titled Boy Meets Dog.

songs.full_title: No Reason (The Mosh Pit Song) by Tech N9ne (Ft. Machine Gun Kelly & Y2)
songs.title: No Reason (The Mosh Pit Song)
songs.title_with_featured: No Reason (The Mosh Pit Song) (Ft. Machine Gun Kelly & Y2)

description.plain:
On December 9th, 2017 Tech posted a snippet of the song stating it would be the first single off of Planet; HOLY SHIT I love my label team cause they all chose this gritty ass song NO REASON (the mosh pit song) Featuring @y2heru and produced by @206derek to be the first single off of my new album #PLANET! This song is what happens when someone tries to weaken the name STRANGE! ANGER!
Unluckily three songs were released before this; “Drink Up”, “Tech N9ne (Don’t Nobody Want None)” and “Bad JuJu”. Most likely referring to when Trippie Redd was a signed to a label called Strainge Entertainment and Strange Music’s CEO, Travis O'Guin filed a lawsuit against them due to naming similarities which caused confusion among fans.

body.plain:
On December 9th, 2017 Tech posted a snippet of the song stating it would be the first single off of Planet; HOLY SHIT I love my label team cause they all chose this gritty ass song NO REASON (the mosh pit song) Featuring @y2heru and produced by @206derek to be the first single off of my new album #PLANET! This song is what happens when someone tries to weaken the name STRANGE! ANGER!
Unluckily three songs were released before this; “Drink Up”, “Tech N9ne (Don’t Nobody Want None)” and “Bad JuJu”. Most likely referring to when Trippie Redd was a signed to a label called Strainge Entertainment and Strange Music’s CEO, Travis O'Guin filed a lawsuit against them due to naming similarities which caused confusion among fans.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BcgNWQOgleQ/?taken-by=therealtechn9ne

songs.full_title: On the Bible by Tech N9ne (Ft. T.I. & Zuse)
songs.title: On the Bible

description.plain:
The 4th single from Tech N9ne’s 2015 album, Special Effects. This track is mainly a hood-related gangster song in which Tech and co. assure us that they are more than just talk.

“You can put it on the Bible” is another way of saying “You can bet your life on it”; the three MC’s are saying you can bet they mean what they say.

Over the past 10 years, Tech N9ne has been gaining fame and has thus been distanced from his hood origins in the public eye. With fame came money, and with money came problems. When Tech’s family heard about him being on the Forbes List, some of them took that to heart. “How could he be making all that money, but I haven’t gotten any yet? I deserve some of this cash!” This is what some of his family members were thinking, so those same people started threatening Tech’s life if he doesn’t pay them what they think they are entitled to.



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cLXp0MY5Mko

songs.full_title: Strangeulation I by Tech N9ne
songs.title: Strangeulation I

description.plain:
Tech N9ne explains why this cypher is important to him in this interview:

“The beat that we used for the cypher is the first beat that I ever rapped on from Seven, before I ever even knew him. There was this thing in Kansas City back when I was young called 50 Emcees put out by DJ Fresh. DJ Fresh reached out to all producers in the area, from Wichita came Seven. […] And we did “Ready For The Meat Wagon” and it was dark. It was dark. Seven produced it. It was the first song I ever did with Seven man. [..] So I always told Seven back in the day, I was like “Man I wanna redo that beat ‘Get Ready For The Meatwagon’ and put the ‘Approach To Danger’ drums on it,” from NWA. So we finally did it man and put “The Meat Wagon” on top of it, re-did it and the beat is monumental to me because of that. It’s the very first time me and Seven ever worked together.”

#Music video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MXIc03slT64

description.plain:
Sixth track on Strangeulation Vol. II and second cypher on the album. This song features verses from Godemis and Ubiquitous of Ces Cru, as well as one from Stevie Stone.

Stevie was originally going to be on the third cypher, but he asked to be on this one instead.

Before song release, Tech N9ne revealed Stevie Stone rapping part of his verse on Instagram.

songs.full_title: What If It Was Me by Tech N9ne (Ft. Krizz Kaliko)
songs.title: What If It Was Me
songs.title_with_featured: What If It Was Me (Ft. Krizz Kaliko)

description.plain: This song is off of Tech’s album “The Storm” with a message about innocent black citizens being killed by gang violence and police killings, Tech mentioning Trayvon Martin in the song. Tech puts himself in the situation of Alton Sterling, who was shot outside of a gas station selling CD’s, and had a gun on him. the song also speaks from the officer’s stance, sung by Krizz Kaliko,  where if they decided to not shoot Sterling, he could have retaliated by killing the officers.

description.plain: Tech has sought after this collaboration for a long time and he releases some anger alongside lead vocalist from Slipknot, Corey Taylor. It is a dark track in which Tech N9ne vents about a sickness within him. He also mentions the untimely loss of his mother, whom the album is dedicated to.

songs.full_title: Who Do I Catch by Tech N9ne
songs.title: Who Do I Catch

description.plain:
The first official single off Tech N9ne’s 13th full studio album and 4th Collabos album, Welcome To Strangeland. This song opens up about how Tech has finally caught the attention of the public, mainstream and music industry and reassuring them that he will not change one bit. REAL SHIT.

This song is somewhat of a follow-up to “Red Nose” off his 2009 album, Sickology 101. In “Red Nose”, he spoke about how because of his different appearance (note the red clothes he sports on stage), he has been treated differently in the rap game and struggles to gain the attention he feels he deserves.

“The Needle” off his 2016 album The Storm, is like a follow-up to this song as well. He feels that he has been at the levels he’s at so long he doubts he could ever make it somewhere everyone can see him, but nevertheless remains hopeful.

Produced by Seven

description.plain:
From the Everready LP, this is a song about those who question Tech N9ne’s credibility and talk shit about his unique style. This is his angry rebuttal.



Produced by Seven.

description.plain:
On the making of Special Effects, Tech said that this song (his verse at least) is about rich people doing funny things, poor people doing funny things, and people doing funny things in general. For example, a multimillionaire hanging around the hood hanging with his boys. Or a broke dude buying a $80,000 car before buying/renting a house.

Each artist goes into detail about what they think applies to “Bass Ackwards.”

songs.full_title: Shroud by Tech N9ne (Ft. Krizz Kaliko)
songs.title: Shroud

description.plain:
Track 6 on Tech N9ne’s 15th studio album Special Effects, “Shroud” is a song reminiscent of Tech’s “dark” works of K.O.D, Boiling Point, and Seepage.

In the song, Tech channels his negative energy by bringing up the aspects of himself, his life, and society that keep him “in the darkness”.

Seven produced some of the beat using a mini-piano he had since he was 1. Joseph Bishara, composer of the soundtracks of horror movies such as The Conjuring, Insidious and Anabelle (who also played a demon in some of them), also worked on the beat.

description.plain:
Big Scoob and J.L. of B. Hood come together to rip this cypher track apart.

At the time of release of this song, JL wasn’t yet confirmed to be signed to Strange Music. His signing was confirmed on 12/12/2015 on the label’s Instagram:
https://twitter.com/StrangeMusicInc/status/675864478907518976?lang=en

The instrumental sampled for this track is “Whip It” by Kutt Calhoun.

Before this song was released, on 11/12/2015, Tech N9ne released a video preview of J.L.’s verse on his Instagram:
https://instagram.com/p/9_2QZkxuou/?taken-by=therealtechn9ne

description.plain:
Digital single off Tech N9ne’s ninth studio album “Tech N9ne Collabos – Sickology 101”.

The music video premiered on MTVU.com on April 13, 2009, while it debuted on Strange Music’s official YouTube on March 24, 2009.

Produced by Matic Lee and the music video was directed by Dan Gedmen.

songs.full_title: Godspeed by Tech N9ne
songs.title: Godspeed

description.plain:
With the anticipation for his upcoming album, Tech N9ne decided to release the intro to the album, similar to the way he did with Aw Yeah? (interVENTion) on his previous album, Special Effects. On November 22, 2016, he released the following message on social media:

From this day on, I will never force anything good down anybody’s throat. #GODSPEED TOMORROW, LIVE ON FACEBOOK! 2PM CST

Following the live Facebook stream, the track was available everywhere.

On January 19, 2016, Tech went on Instagram to announce that he had just finished writing the lyrics to this song.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BAvZFBRxujd/

songs.full_title: Alone by Tech N9ne (Ft. Eric Boone & Krizz Kaliko)
songs.title: Alone

description.plain:
“Alone” is the seventh and last track on Boiling Point by Tech N9ne, featuring Eric “Ezikuhl” Boone and Krizz Kaliko. It is also the last song in “The Hole”.

In particular, Tech is depressed due to his lack of attention and recognition. Ever since Michael Jones was shot at Tech N9ne’s Las Vegas concert in 2011, Tech has been shied away from crowded areas. The sudden lack of people has saddened him. On top of that, Tech reminisces on loved ones that have been pushed away from him on his quest for musical domination.

songs.full_title: Slow to Me by Tech N9ne (Ft. Krizz Kaliko & Rittz)
songs.title: Slow to Me
songs.title_with_featured: Slow to Me (Ft. Krizz Kaliko & Rittz)

description.plain:
This is seemingly the sequel to “Make Waves” from the previous Strangeulation album, where the same three rappers as this song showed off their flows and speed.

Tech N9ne drops some new heat for his fans to show that he still has it. A classic chopper anthem from Strange Music that once again highlights the epic chopping skills and dope flows of Tech, Krizz Kaliko, and Rittz.

The lyrics show how Tech and Co. are tired of the auto-tuned choppy style that some artists are calling “chopping”, and Tech showcases what the real chopping sounds like, having the technique mastered for years.

Before this song was released, Tech revealed on Instagram that writing for Strangeulation Vol II (the sequel to his previous collaboration album Strangeulation) had officially begun, and he also announced that he was writing the chorus for a song called “That’s Slow To Me”. On the pad in front of him we can see the initials “T.S.T.M” and the word “chorus” written as a header. This song was released as “Slow To Me” instead.

https://instagram.com/p/6qX36mxunu/?taken-by=therealtechn9ne

http://www.strangemusicinc.com/2015/08/tech-n9ne/tech-n9ne-collabos-strangeulation-2-writing-has-begun/

songs.title: K.O.D.

description.plain:
This is Tech’s bible

The song’s setting is the end of the world. Tech takes the role of dictator and saves many people from the end of the world. He starts a new civilization that protects these people from harm. In exchange for protection the people must obey his every command.

Samples Gonzale’s “Gogol”

songs.lyrics:
[Intro: Tech N9ne]
Mhm, okay
I hear you
No
Yes
I'm your servant
I have the plan
And I'll give it to 'em
Like you told me to

[Verse 1: Tech N9ne]
Wanna live in my world you have to have a Tech tat
Preferably the number N9ne and you gotta get it
Where the back of your neck's at
That'll let me know that you rep that, plus get you out of a death trap
You need it for living 'cause I'm the king
And I'm giving you the permission to get with a no stress pact
Novus Ordo Seclorum 'cause the old world orders' post mortem
It's failure inhaling sailing delta
Watched it swell and swelter
'Til there was no male in shelter
Yes I'm the one that provided ya shell in hell and held ya
When your politicians were welchers
So I built this structure just to help ya
So the communists can't come and quell ya
They call me the King of Darkness when I offer you no pain
Why would they label me heartless when your love is my cocaine
And your soul is my Rogaine, I have a thirst to know your brain
When you enter my domain gotta take this number for your name
But you don't have to drink cyanide, I'm gonna be right by your side
If we gotta take that riot ride on the enemy and defy your side
Fight for the place we're building
For the reproduction of more children
Trying to get that number back around 6 billion
I'm gonna rule until then
Founded this colony like a pilgrim
Anybody try to penetrate this section or threaten we KILL THEM

[Hook: Mackenzie O'Guin]
What if?
K. O. D. oh K. O. D. oh
What if, he is, what he says he is?
The King Of Darkness!
K. O. D. oh K. O. D. oh
What if, he is, what he says he is?
The King Of Darkness!

[Verse 2: Tech N9ne]
Xes lliw eb yrotadnam yliad
Ylthgin, this women need to be living by it
Stay fit n' way driven paste it and dye it
I am the king killer captain crazed frigging pilot
Giving you these khaki pants and white shirt
That's what you wear on my Earth
Eliminating your eye thirst to have any kind of desires
To envy material or admire, my way will extract any type of divider
I'm offering this wider
Understanding of life entirely
Blissfully evading friction and fire, chea
The number N9ne will get you food, even get you tools
To build anything your family choose, but within my rules
All white shoes with red strings for all my crews
That lets me know you Tech's people listening inside my pews
All your dreams and aspirations, this is the affirmation
That you can reach 'em in my world it's not a disaster waiting
No bruises and lacerations no choosers of aggravation
I'm just try'na rehab a nation from exasperation
It's not an exaggeration, I'm something more than your blood and gore
On a level higher than devils or that of Satan

[Hook: Mackenzie O'Guin]
What if?
K. O. D. oh K. O. D. oh
What if, he is, what he says he is?
The King Of Darkness!
K. O. D. oh K. O. D. oh
What if, he is, what he says he is?
The King Of Darkness!

[Verse 3: Tech N9ne]
When I did 'Anghellic' I was good and bad, straight confused
Then an angel turned to "Devil Boy" when the 'Reparation' blew
Then demons had 'Absolute Power' when I drug abused
So the angels searched for the 'Vintage Tech'
But they found that the love was through
Then an accident would happen that made life look necessary
So now receiving God, the angel was 'Everready'
But the 'Melancholy' strikes, the loving angels mommy's life
So the 'Misery' sat in the angels now becoming ice
So as mom got ill and iller, when it hurts her he can feel her
To the strain of the pain made him bane
There's no more angel straight up 'Killer'!
My apologies, it's not very God of me
To go crazy and try to teach the whole world 'Sickology'
I was then split in two, back to the beginning view
Angel/demon 'cause the killer showed me death was overdue
But I gotta live for my kids, all the evil stuff I did
Taught me to teach you, you can love big no matter how much mud you dig
Or dug, you met my demon back when I had that grudge
But I gotta let you know most of my spirit comes from up above
I'm mostly angel, and you know sometime we fall
Living under God and I hope it's listening when I say I love you all!
